basics.name: Gregory Danielson III
basics.label: Programming Manager
basics.summary: Programming Manager specializing in community safety via natural language processing. Over five years developing technologies to detect illicit activity on social media platforms, building automation solutions to ensure maximum uptime of our safety technologies, and training developers for success in all areas through honed insight and leadership.

work.name: DarkTower
work.summary: Leading the re-architecture of our social media analysis tools toward a new, more sustainable monetization model

work.name: Computer Forensics Research Laboratory
work.description: Studying social media to identify criminal activity and stop it.
work.summary: Led the development of state of the art discovery/analysis technologies for identifying criminal activity on social media
highlights: Led research and implementation of a facial recognition index built on our social media data, created with python's deepface and elasticsearch's small world graph discovery
Began work on a database redesign which would enable full cross-platform entity discovery
Re-designed production systems to build onto a cloud-lite Docker Swarm cluster to enable faster iteration on products and services
Improved speed and consistency of Gitlab CI, with added support for our database images, more of our services, and automated new version publishing
Trained incoming developers on our systems, technologies, and development methodology to encourage success

work.name: Computer Forensics Research Laboratory
work.summary: Database and systems administration, devops, backend development, archicture, technical leadership.
highlights: Led technical projects to the signing of several high-value contracts, including the acquisition of a $750,000 contract for our work on Twitter
Developed and maintained tools for capturing content from social media including Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and other OSINT data sources
Developed a data model for storing and accessing mass social media data across multiple platforms to/from a highly available PostgreSQL cluster
Disigned and contributed to many supportive React webapps with an asynchronous python web backend for accessing and analyzing aforementioned captured data
Re-designed devops/deployment process into automated test, report, deploy scheme on Gitlab CI, resulting in faster iteration and more uptime
Deployed and administrated an Elasticsearch cluster, allowing elasticsearch-supported full text search in the form of a PostgreSQL index
Maintained and administered a pair of high performance CentOS servers for serving end users, mass compute, mass storage of data, running workers for aforementioned data capturing tools

references.name: Gary Warner
references.position: Lab Coordinator at Computer Forensics Research Laboratory, Professor at University of Alabama at Birmingham

projects.name: Linku: a Toki Pona dictionary in a bot, site, and database
projects.description: The Toki Pona community had dozens of differently thorough and opinionated dictionaries. Now it has one, with a collection of suppporting tools to help anyone use the data.
highlights: Redesigned and automated testing of data scheme in a way which compromises between non-tech accessibility and computer-aided searching, improving consistency
Connected frontend with Crowdin for up-to-date translation availability in over 40 languages
Re-designed search in web dictionary and discord bot to better match user expectations
Designed a reproducible environment for bot development and deployment

projects.name: ilo pi toki pona taso: Tool for only Toki Pona
projects.description: A Discord bot that reminds you to speak Toki Pona! Now with features!
highlights: Responds near instantly to use in ~30 servers, including the >10,000 member 'ma pona pi toki pona' and >4000 member 'kama sona'.
Customizable behavior for both servers and end users
Implements novel methods of detecting Toki Pona, allowing for a wide variety of means of speaking while still having a high accuracy and precision.

projects.name: wttr.in
projects.description: A weather service for your terminal. `curl wttr.in`
highlights: Corrected a longstanding bug where the province/state would be lost when searching for the current weather by IP. For example, fetching weather from a Helena, Alabama IP would return weather for Helena, Montana.
Adjusted the cache system in a backwards compatible manner to preserve all metadata from geolocation lookups.
